intro: Borreria verbenoides, commonly known as Mexican verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are often lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Borreria verbenoides is also known for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
